dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4183 IH: Federal Maritime Commission Reauthorization Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of South Dakota (for himself, Mr. Garamendi, Mr. Ezell, and Mr. Carbajal) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To authorize appropriations for the Federal Maritime Commission for fiscal years 2026 through 2029, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Maritime Commission Reauthorization Act of 2025.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 11. Annual report and public disclosures.

section.text: Section 46108 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking $32,869,000 for fiscal year 2022, $38,260,000 for fiscal year 2023, $43,720,000 for fiscal year 2024, and $49,200,000 for fiscal year 2025 and inserting $49,200,000 for fiscal year 2026, $51,660,000 for fiscal year 2027, $54,243,000 for fiscal year 2028, and $57,016,000 for fiscal year 2029.
Section 40101 of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2) by striking in the ocean commerce of the United States and inserting for the common carriage of goods by water in the foreign commerce of the United States; and
in paragraph (4) by striking promote and inserting support.

subsection.text: Section 40102(9) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B) by striking the period and inserting ; or;
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively, and by adjusting the margins accordingly;
by striking means an ocean common carrier and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: such a carrier that is owned or controlled by, a subsidiary of, or otherwise related legally or financially (other than a minority relationship or investment) to a corporation based in a country—

clause.text: identified as a nonmarket economy country (as defined in section 771(18) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1677(18))) as of the date of enactment of the Federal Maritime Commission Reauthorization Act of 2025;

identified by the United States Trade Representative in the most recent report required by section 182 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2242) as a priority foreign country under subsection (a)(2) of that section; or
subject to monitoring by the United States Trade Representative under section 306 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2416).

subsection.text: Section 46106(b)(7) of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking ocean common carriers, particularly such carriers that are controlled carriers and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting controlled carriers;.
Section 40504(c) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the subsection heading by inserting and investigation after Exemption;
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and;
by striking may exempt and inserting the following:
exempt
by adding at the end the following:
investigate complaints submitted under section 40505.

subsection.text: Chapter 405 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

A person may submit to the Federal Maritime Commission, and the Commission shall accept, information concerning alleged incidents of market manipulation or other anticompetitive practices by shipping exchanges registered under section 40504.
Upon receipt of a submission of information under subsection (a), the Commission shall promptly investigate the accuracy of such information.

The Commission shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate the results of any investigation in which the Commission finds incidents of market manipulation or anticompetitive practices by shipping exchanges registered under section 40504.
The analysis for chapter 405 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.text: Section 40504(d) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 3 years after the date of enactment of the Ocean Shipping Reform Act of 2022 and inserting 2 years after the date of enactment of the Federal Maritime Commission Reauthorization Act of 2025;
by striking set standards necessary to carry out and inserting ensure consistency with; and
by striking by and inserting via.

subsection.text: Section 40706 of title 46, United States Code, is repealed.
The analysis for chapter 407 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 40706.

section.text: Section 41110 of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The Federal Maritime Commission and inserting the following:

subsection.text: The Federal Maritime Commission

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Unless the data described in paragraphs (1) and (2) is not available in a timely manner or in a form that allows the Commission to meet the requirements of subsection (a), data required to be reported under subsection (a) may not duplicate information submitted—

paragraph.text: to the Corps of Engineers pursuant to section 11 of the Act entitled An Act authorizing the construction, repair, and preservation of certain public works on rivers and harbors, and for other purposes, approved September 22, 1922 (33 U.S.C. 555), by an ocean common carrier acting as a vessel operator;
pursuant to section 481 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1481) to U.S. Customs and Border Protection by merchandise importers; or
to the Department of Commerce pursuant to section 301 of title 13.

section.text: Section 41302 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Information and documents developed by the Federal Maritime Commission under this section shall not be disclosed unless the Commission determines by majority vote of the Commission that such information and documents are relevant to an administrative or judicial proceeding and agrees by a majority vote to disclose such information and documents.
Section 42502 of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) by striking Committee. and inserting Committee (in this section referred to as the Shipper Committee).;
by striking subsection (b);
by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b); and
in subsection (b), as so redesignated, by striking Committee each place it appears and inserting Shipper Committee.

subsection.text: Chapter 425 of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 42503 as section 42506; and
by inserting after section 42502 the following:

subsection.text: There is established a National Port Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the Port Committee).

paragraph.text: The Port Committee shall consist of 13 members appointed by the Commission in accordance with this section.
Each member of the Port Committee shall have particular expertise, knowledge, and experience in matters relating to the function of the Port Committee.
Members of the Port Committee shall be appointed as follows:

subparagraph.text: 5 members shall represent marine terminal operators, as such term is defined in section 40102.
3 members shall represent longshore and maritime labor.

subsection.text: There is established a National Ocean Carrier Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the Carrier Committee”).

paragraph.text: The Carrier Committee shall consist of 9 members appointed by the Commission in accordance with this section.
Each member of the Carrier Committee shall have particular expertise, knowledge, and experience in matters relating to the function of the Committee.

Members of the Carrier Committee shall represent ocean carriers serving such seaports and terminals, of which at least 3 shall be ocean transportation intermediaries (as such term is defined in section 40102).

section.text: The covered Committees shall advise the Federal Maritime Commission on policies relating to the competitiveness, reliability, and efficiency of the international ocean freight delivery system.

paragraph.text: Section 42501(2) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
The term covered Committee means—

subparagraph.text: the National Shipper Advisory Committee established under section 42502;
the National Port Advisory Committee established under section 42503; and
the National Ocean Carrier Advisory Committee established under section 52504.

paragraph.text: Section 42506 of title 46, United States Code, as redesignated by subsection (b)(1), is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking The Committee each place it appears except in subsection (k) and inserting Each covered Committee;
in subsection (a) by striking the Committee and inserting each such Committee;
in subsections (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), and (j) by striking the Committee each place it appears and inserting a covered Committee;

subclause.text: by striking Chair of the Committee and inserting Chair of each covered Committee; and
by striking function of the Committee and inserting function of the applicable Committee; and

clause.text: in paragraph (2) by striking the Committee and inserting each covered Committee;
in paragraph (1) by striking the Committee if the function of the Committee and inserting any relevant covered Committee if the function of such Committee;
in paragraph (2) by striking the Committee and inserting each such Committee;

subclause.text: by striking from the Committee and inserting from a covered Committee; and
in subparagraph (B) by striking to the Committee and inserting to the submitting Committee; and

clause.text: in paragraph (4) by striking from the Committee and inserting from a covered Committee; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (k) by striking The Committee and inserting The covered Committees.

subsection.header: Report on foreign laws and practices
subsection.text: Section 46106(b) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6)—

subparagraph.text: by striking and at the end; and
by striking under this part and inserting under chapter 403;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (7)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting anticompetitive, nonreciprocal trade, or before otherwise concerning practices;
by inserting or marine terminal operators after controlled carriers; and
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
an analysis of any trade imbalance resulting from the business practices of ocean common carriers, including an analysis of the data collected under section 41110; and
the aggregated findings and results of the Vessel-Operating Common Carrier Audit Program established by the Commission on July 18, 2021, pursuant to the Commission rule interpreting section 41102(c).

subsection.text: Section 46106(d)(2) of title 46, United States Code, is amended by inserting or marine terminal operator after common carrier.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Federal Maritime Commission shall promulgate an advance notice of proposed rulemaking on price indexes for containerized ocean freight for shippers (as such term is defined in section 40102 of title 46, United States Code) in the United States published by a shipping exchange registered under section 40504 of title 46, United States Code.
Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall publish a final rule with respect to the advance notice of proposed rulemaking required under subsection (a).
The analysis for subtitle IV of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to chapter 425 and inserting the following:
The heading and analysis for chapter 425 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 42504. National Ocean Carrier Advisory Committee.
